resources.string: L\'application s\'est écrasé lors de la dernière exécution avec l\'erreur [%1$s].\n\n S\'il vous plaît nous dire à ce sujet à %2$s.
Etes-vous sûr de vouloir supprimer ce paquet?
Ce n\'est pas un package JAR valide!
Il n\'ya pas de mode de %1$s à %2$s
Sélectionnez la langue à traduire à partir <de>
Mise à jour base de données
Télécharger et installer directement à partir d\'Internet
Base de données mise à jour
Mettre à jour ou réparer la base de données
Widgets comme raccourci pour la langue spécifique

This is an open source, off-line machine translation application which offers most of the language directions from Apertium.
Apertium is a free, open-source, rule-based, machine translation project and platform.
This program don\'t send your text through the Internet to get a translation, and it doesn\'t require an internet connection for translation.

Using this app

You can mark text in e.g. the web browser, long-press and select to "Share" with Apertium to put it into the translator.
The first translation you do will be probably be slow, on older phones it can take up to a minute. The subsequent translations will be faster.
On smaller phones you are adviced to start out installing just one language pair.
To download language pairs we require internet access in this version. If you feel unconfident about that, you can switch off data connections while translating, or you can download the source code and build your own version.

Apertium in general

Apertium can be installed on your own desktop machine, and is bundled with several Linux flavors.
If you want to quickly try it out on the desktop there are zero-install Java web start applets for most languages.

Need help creating your own offline translation service?

This app is an open source showcase of how to do offline translation. We encourage you to copy it and modify as you like. There is a lively volunteer-driven community, ready to help developers and end users. Please see http://wiki.apertium.org for how to get in touch.

Something missing? Want to make your own language pair?

It takes around 3 months of full time work to create a language pair from scratch.
We at Apertium will help you, of course, and if you are a student you could consider engaging in Apertium work being sponsored by the Google Summer of Code free/open-source program (see http://code.google.com/intl/ca/soc/). Please contact us for details!

Authors and contributors

This app would not have been possible without the support of Google Summer of Code (GSoC) stipends. 
2012 Mikel Artetxe artetxem@gmail.com

Making Java port of lttoolbox embeddable during GSoC 2012



2012 Arink Verma arinkverma@gmail.com

Created an Android app using lttoolbox-java during GSoC 2012



2012 Jacob Nordfalk jacob.nordfalk@gmail.com

Mentor of Mikel and Arink
Re-architect lttoolbox-java for memory constrained devices
Android app revision autumn 2012



2010 Stephen Tigner stephen.tigner@gmail.com

Java port of the Apertium C++ library during GSoC 2010
